Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.packet

Record Packet

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.packet.Packet
public record Packet(Packet.PacketType type, Packet.ErrorCode code, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String pseudo)
extends java.lang.Record
Represents a packet circulating between the server and the clients. A packet is always starting with a Packet.PacketType that defines it's meaning. The other fields can be null if not useful with this type. The following list explains what are the different types and which fields they use.
  • Packet.PacketType.ERR (code and pseudo) : This packet notifies an incorrect behavior.
  • Packet.PacketType.AUTH (pseudo) : This packet is used by the client to register to the server. The pseudo is the unique identifier for this client.
  • Packet.PacketType.GMSG (message and pseudo) : This packet is a General Message. A message from a client to everyone.
  • Packet.PacketType.DMSG (message and pseudo) : This packet is a Direct Message. A message from a client to another.
  • Packet.PacketType.PC (pseudo) : This packet is Private Connection. It is used to establish a connection between two clients.
  • Packet.PacketType.TOKEN (message, pseudo) : This packet is a special packet used to register to the server as a private connection. The token is an unique identifier sent to the both ends of a private connection.
For more explanations, see Protocol.txt.

  • Method Details

    • toBuffer

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer toBuffer()
      Creates a buffer representing the packet that is sent according to the protocol CHATOS.
      Returns:
      a buffer in read-mode containing the message to be sent. The returned buffer is a new one for each call.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any string encoded in StandardCharsets.UTF_8 is greater than ChatOSUtils.TEXT_SIZE.

    • toString

      public final java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record. The representation contains the name of the type, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      toString in class java.lang.Record
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class java.lang.Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
